CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National Edition, April 10, 1948, pg. 3, reads: "Democratic Policy - Pittsburgh's Owl Cab Company, Negro owned and operated, recently adopted a policy of hiring mixed personnel. Here a new driver, Francis C. James, white, opens the door for a passenger.  The company promised to hire some white operators as soon as its quota was raised to seventy-five cabs. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Owl Cab driver Francis C. James holding door open for passenger, on street with Fort-Pitt Beer sign in background
